sentences.sContent: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.sCn: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.sContent: ...the Europeans failed to anticipate how the markets would react to their endless borrowing...

synos.tran: 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

remMethod.val: anti(先) ＋ cip(拿) ＋ ate(做) → 先拿到 → 先于…行动

words.tran: 预期的；提早发生的；期待着的
希望；预感；先发制人；预支

trans.tranCn: 预料， 预期， 期望； 先于…行动， 提前使用
trans.tranOther: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it
